Description: Two joining sherds of rim of North Ionian pottery bowl with handle root; cream slip; interior: key maeander band between lines above lotus and bud frieze with added red; exterior: uncertain motifs at rim, perhaps different to either side of handle; spirals and palmettes emerging from handle, pendant lotus flower between handle roots; added red on leaves; below, band with added red band lined in white, and body frieze with antler of deer or goat to left.
Curator's comments: GR 1924,1201,235, 943-949 and 971 probably all belong to the same bowl, with some doubt about 948a; on the inside it has key maeander at the rim above lotus and bud frieze; there are two goat friezes below. Outside has key maeander at rim, black-figure animals in handle zone, and two goat friezes below, above a lotus band near the foot. On 948a there appears the only goat with reversed head.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.114)
